title: Rilquer Mascarenhas
text:
My name is Rilquer Mascarenhas and I am a PhD Student in the Carnaval Lab of The City College of New York.
As a evolutionary biologist, I am interested in understanding the processes that drive the spatial distribution of biodiversity across different scales. I am specially interested in integrating different data sources and methodological approaches to investigate intraspecific genetic diversity.
My current PhD research focuses on understanding how the ecological characteristics of species influence how they interact with their surrounding environment and shape the demographic history revealed in their DNA sequences. For that, I am integrating several analytical tools along with ecological datasets to evaluate the importance of ecology in population response to habitat change.
